summary: This document details the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey on July 6, 2019, following a federal arrest warrant for sex trafficking of minors. It outlines the circumstances of his arrival from Paris, the involvement of various law enforcement agents, and his subsequent processing.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport on a federal warrant for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent was involved in the arrest and processing of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: A Detective was part of the team that arrested Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: CBP Agent
persons.context: CBP Agents processed Epstein upon his return to the United States.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: A Supervisory Special Agent supervised the arrest operation.

persons.name: NYPD Lieutenant
persons.context: An NYPD Lieutenant assisted with the arrest operation.

connections.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the Special Agent as part of the operation.
Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the Detective who was part of the task force.
CBP Agents processed Jeffrey Epstein upon his arrival back in the United States.
The Supervisory Special Agent supervised the operation in which the NYPD Lieutenant assisted.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport after arriving from Paris, following a federal warrant for sex trafficking.

events.title: Initial Appearance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled for his initial appearance in court following his arrest.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport.
He was returning from Paris, France, on his plane with tail number N212JE.
The arrest was made pursuant to a federal warrant for sex trafficking of minors.
Epstein was read his rights and requested to speak with his lawyer before questioning.
The operation involved multiple law enforcement agents, including FBI and CBP personnel.
